section.title: Synopsis
section.description: [para] poldek.conf contains runtime configuration information for poldek package management tool. The complete description of the file format and possible parameters held within are here for reference purposes. [/para]

section.title: File format
section.description:
[para] The file consists of directives, sections and parameters. A section begins with thename of the section in square brackets and continues until the next section begins ('ini'-like format). Sections contain parameters of the form: [screen] name = value [/screen] [/para][para] The file is line-based - that is, each newline-terminated line represents either a comment, a section name or a parameter. Any line beginning with a hash (``#'') character is ignored, as are lines containing only whitespace. [/para][para]
In most string paramameters values environment variables are expanded: [screen] path = $HOME/foo [/screen] [/para]

section.title: Special directives and macros
section.description:
[para] File can be combined from multiple configuration files with [option]%include[/option] directive. This directive can include either local and remote HTTP/FTP files, examples: [screen] %include /etc/foo.conf # simply include /etc/foo.conf %include foo.conf # include foo.conf from directory of includer %include http://bar.org/foo.conf # include foo.conf from remote location [/screen] Any "[ global ]" sections from included files are simply ignored. Files taken from remote locations can be updated using --upconf switch. [/para]
[para] Simple macros are supported. Macros are declared as paramameter with underscore ('_') at beginning: [screen] _foo = /bar [/screen] and can be expanded in any following value in %{NAME} form: [screen] path = %{_foo}/dir # path will be '/bar/dir' [/screen] Macros are local to file beeing declared, they are not visible in included files as are not visible to includer. [/para]

section.title: Section descriptions
section.description:
[para] There are three section types: [ global ], [ source ] and [ fetcher ]. [variablelist][title][/title] [varlistentry][term][option][ global ][/option][/term] [listitem][para] Section contains global paramameters. May be declared multiple times, in this case content of all global sections are concatenated. [/para][/listitem] [/varlistentry]
[varlistentry][term][option][ source ][/option][/term] [listitem][para] This section contains poldek's repository configuration. Each section describes one repository. [/para][/listitem] [/varlistentry]
[varlistentry][term][option][ fetcher ][/option][/term] [listitem][para] Configuration of external file getters. Each section declares one external downloader. [/para][/listitem] [/varlistentry] [/variablelist] [/para] [para] To make things simpler default configuration consists of several files. Repositories are declared in separate [filename]source.conf[/filename] and [filename]*-source.conf[/filename], file getters are declared in [filename]fetch.conf[/filename]. All of them are included by [filename]poldek.conf[/filename]. [/para]

# poldek main configuration file.
# Some macros. Macros are local, they are not visible in included files # and macros declared in them are not visible to includer. # Macros names starts with underscore '_'. # _distro = pld
# Both local and remote files may be included. Included files may not contain # [ global ] section, it will be ignored anyway. %include %{_distro}-source.conf
# local sources %include source.conf
# External downloaders configuration, not necessary in most cases, cause # to internal HTTP and FTP client. #%include fetch.conf
[ global ]

option.name: default index type
option.description: This parameter allows to configure the default repository index type.

option.name: cachedir
option.description: Cache directory for downloaded files. NOTE: that parent directory of cachedir must exists.

option.name: runas
option.description: Switch to ordinary user at startup when executed by root

option.name: use sudo
option.description: Permits using root privileges for installation only. Automatically turned on when poldek executed as ordinary user.

option.name: load apt sources list
option.description: Load [filename]/etc/apt/sources.list[/filename]. The default is "yes" if system wide configuration file is used, "no" if user config ([filename]$HOME/.poldekrc[/filename]) is used.

option.name: vfile external compress
option.description: Handle gzipped indexes externally (needed on RedHat 9 and Fedora Core 1 and 2). This option is a workaround for broken zlib linked into librpm; with enabled 'auto zlib in rpm' poldek tries to detect such case and then enables external *.gz handling automatically.

option.name: auto zlib in rpm
option.description: Auto detection of zlib linked into librpm. See 'vfile external compress' description.

option.name: autoupa
option.description: Automatically download whole index if incremental update fails.

option.name: exclude path
option.description: Do not save given paths into created indexes. This option may significantly reduce index size. Example (notice missing starting '/'): [screen] exclude path = usr/share/doc:usr/share/man:usr/src [/screen]

option.name: vfile ftp sysuser as anon passwd
option.description: Send ${USER}@${HOSTNAME} as anonymous FTP password (by default [literal]'poldek@znienacka.net'[/literal] is sent)

option.name: default fetcher
option.description: File getters configuration parameter. By this option URL handlers may be configured. To get file from HTTP and FTP servers poldek uses its internal client (what is recommended), although it can be changedby this option. Others protocols handled by external utilities can be configured also. The syntax is: [screen] default fetcher = PROTOCOL[,PROTOCOL...]:FETCHER_NAME [/screen] where FETCHER_NAME is a name of one of the fetcher preconfigured in [ fetch ] sections (placed in [filename]fetch.conf[/filename] in default configuration). Examples: [screen] default fetcher = ftp,http:internal default fetcher = https:wget default fetcher = cdrom:vfjuggle [/screen] [filename]vfjuggle[/filename] is a cdrom getter supplied with poldek.

option.name: proxy
option.description: Proxies for internal FTP and HTTP client may be configured in usual way, by environment variables ftp_proxy and http_proxy, or by this option. Its syntax is similar to "default fetcher" one: [screen] proxy = PROTOCOL[,PROTOCOL...]:PROXY_URL [/screen] Example: [screen] proxy = http: http://w3cache.foo.org:8080 [/screen]

option.name: vfile retries
option.description: Internal HTTP and FTP client is stubborn, it retries to retrive file if connection breaks. This option tells it how many times it should try.

option.name: particle install
option.description: Install packages in small groups instead of doing all-or-nothing installations.

option.name: keep downloads
option.description: Do not remove downloaded packages after its successful installation.

option.name: unique package names
option.description: Controls visibility of multiple package instances with different EVR. If on, only one, highest version will be visible.

option.name: promoteepoch
option.description: Epoch autopromotion during dependency comparision. RPM specific. Set it up if you are using system with rpm prior to 4.2.1 version.

option.name: confirm installation
option.description: Confirm packages installation.

option.name: confirm removal
option.description: Confirm packages removal.

option.name: choose equivalents manually
option.description: Let the user select package among equivalents.

option.name: hold
option.description: Prevent package listed from being upgraded if they are already installed. [screen] hold = kernel* dev [/screen]

option.name: ignore
option.description: Ignore package list - packages fits given mask will be invisible. [screen] ignore = *-smp-* foo* [/screen]

option.name: allow duplicates
option.description: Conflicts with already installed packages are treated as resolved if at least one of multiple-installed package satisfies conflict. rpm doesn't support such cases, so --pm-nodeps is needed (use with care).

option.name: rpmdef
option.description: rpm macros can be set by this option. Examples: [screen] rpmdef = _install_langs pl:pl_PL:lt:lt_LT [/screen] Do not install any documentation: [screen] rpmdef = _netsharedpath /usr/share/info:/usr/share/man rpmdef = _excludedocs 1 [/screen]

optiongroup.title: Dependency processing settings
optiongroup.description: Subtle dependency processing options, they should not be changed unless you know what you are doing

option.name: follow
option.description: Automatically install packages required by installed ones.

option.name: greedy
option.description: Greedy upgrades, i.e. upgrade packages which dependencies are broken by being uninstalled ones.

option.name: aggressive greedy
option.description: Be yet more greedy; if successor of orphaned package found, and this successor drags no packages then upgrade the package instead of process its dependencies. Option value is implied by 'greedy' one by defalut.

option.name: mercy
option.description: Be tolerant for unmatched versioned dependencies which rpm tolerates, e.g. package A requires capability foo >= 1.0 while package B provides "foo" without any version. Use with care, it may cause weird dependency errors.

option.name: obsoletes
option.description: Taking into account package Obsoletes.

option.name: conflicts
option.description: Taking into account package Conflicts.

section.description: # Sample poldek sources configuration # Every source is configured in his own [ source ] section. # Possible parameters are: # #[ source ]

confsection.name: source
confsection.description: This section contains poldek's repository configuration. Every repository is configured in its own [ source ] section.

option.name: name
option.description: Unique name of the repository.

option.name: type
option.description: Type of repository index. Permitted values are 'pndir', 'pdir', 'apt', 'yum' and 'dir' as listed by $ poldek --stl.

option.name: original type
option.description: This parameter sets index original type i.e type of repository from what this repository is created. Default is 'dir' - means that directory of packages is scanned.

option.name: path
option.description: Unique name of the repository. May be either path or URL.

option.name: prefix
option.description: If package index and packages are stored in different locations then prefix stands for packages path.

option.name: douniq
option.description: Controls visibility of multiple package instances with different EVR. If on, only one, highest version will be visible.

option.name: pri
option.description: Repository priority. If the same packages (equal names and EVR) are available in more than one source then package from highest prioritized source are taken. Priority is numeric value. Lower number means higher priority, and negative priorities are allowed. Priority is numeric value.

option.name: auto
option.description: Controling if repository index will be implicit loaded. Set it off if the index should be loaded on demand only, i.e. if specified directly by --sn option.

option.name: autoup
option.description: Controls if repository index will be implicit updated. Set it off if the index should be updated on demand only, i.e. if specified directly by --sn option.

option.name: signed
option.description: Packages PGP/GPG signatures (if any) will be verified before their installation.

option.name: hold
option.description: Have the same meaning as [ global ] parameter. Example: [screen] hold = kernel* dev [/screen]

option.name: ignore
option.description: Have the same meaning as [ global ] parameter. Example: [screen] ignore = kernel*smp* dev [/screen]

option.name: exclude path
option.description: Parameter have the same meaning as [ global ] parameter. [screen] exclude path = usr/share/doc:usr/share/man:usr/src [/screen]

option.name: lang
option.description: Preferred language of package descriptions. If not set, taken from locale settings. Example: [screen] lang = pl_PL:lt_LT [/screen]

optiongroup.footer:
[ source ] name = home type = dir path = $HOME/rpm/RPMS auto = no autoup = no
#[ source ] #type = pndir #name = foo #path = ftp://ftp.foo.bar.org/RPMS/ #pri = -10 #auto = no #autoup = no #signed = yes #hold = kernel* #ignore = kernel*-smp-* #dscr = pl_PL

section.description: # Configuration of poldek external file getters. Each [ fetcher ] section # declares one external downloader. The syntax is: # [ fetcher ] # name = NAME # proto = PROTOCOL[ ,PROTOCOL... ] # cmd = CMD [OPTION...] DESTINATION-MACRO URL-MACRO # Possible parameters are: # #[ fetcher ]

confsection.name: fetcher
confsection.description: This section contains external downloaders configuration. Each section describes one fetcher.

option.name: name
option.description: Unique name of the fetcher. This is an optional parameter, if not set then name is taken from the "cmd" parameter value as "$(basename $cmd)".

option.name: proto
option.description: Protocol or protocols supported by fetcher. Name of the protocol can be completely arbitrary, i.e. if you can handle protocol "foo" by writing a script which takes URLs in form 'foo://'.

option.name: cmd
option.description: Parameter specifies an external command and its invoking syntax. The syntax of "cmd" is: [screen] cmd = COMMAND [ OPTION... ] {%d,%D} {%p,%P}[ n ] [/screen] Where COMMAND is the name or full path of command, OPTION is command specific options. Macro '%d' is replaced with cache directory, '%D' is replaced with 'cache directory/file basename', and '%p' with file basename, %P with file full path (URL). Optional suffix 'n' with %p and %P means that command can be invoked with multiple files at once.

optiongroup.footer:
##Configured fetchers [ fetcher ] proto = cdrom cmd = vfjuggle %d %Pn
[ fetcher ] proto = http,ftp,https cmd = wget -N --dot-style=binary -P %d %Pn
[ fetcher ] proto = http,ftp cmd = snarf %P %D
[ fetcher ] proto = https cmd = curl %P -o %D
[ fetcher ] proto = rsync cmd = rsync -v %P %d
[ fetcher ] proto = smb cmd = vfsmb -v %P %d
#[ fetcher ] #proto = ssh #cmd = vfssh.sh %d %Pn
#[ fetcher ] #proto = foo #cmd = foo.sh %d %Pn
